name: 2018/10/17 Dinner
description: This Healthyfied dinner is perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb diet. Made with pangasius, fresh vegetables, and seasoned with lemon juice and ground pepper, it's a nutritious choice that does not skimp on flavor. Ideal for anyone looking for healthy recipes that are delicious and easy to prepare.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Pangasius fillets and pat them dry. Lay them out on a baking dish.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle 0.50 tbsp of lemon juice over the Pangasius fillets. Season with 0.12 teaspoon of salt and 0.25 tsp of ground pepper evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice the carrots into thin strips.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the cabbage into bite-sized pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chopped vegetables around the Pangasius in the baking dish.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, until the fish is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: While the fish and vegetables are baking, prepare the sauce by mixing 2 tbsp of mayonnaise with 0.25 tbsp of lemon juice.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Once cooked, remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Pangasius and vegetables with the lemon-mayonnaise sauce drizzled on top or on the side.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 10
